newsitem.title: BELGIUM: Commission to adopt beef labelling proposal Friday.
newsitem.headline: Commission to adopt beef labelling proposal Friday.

text.p: The European Commission is likely to approve on Friday under written procedure a proposal to introduce an EU-wide beef labelling scheme aimed at restoring consumer confidence, an official said on Wednesday.
"A previous written proceedure had been blocked by German Industry Commissioner Martin Bangemann over changes he wanted made," the official said.
Farm Commissioner Franz Fischler and Commissioner Bangemann have now agreed on changes to the original proposal, the official said without giving details.
But he added that producers and distributors would he held responsible for ensuring what is on the labels is correct, the official added.
Under the scheme all beef would carry a label stating where the animal was born, fattened, how it was fed and where it was slaughtered.
This aspect of the legislation would be linked to a system of animal passports requiring all cattle to carry ear tags and be registered on a computer data base.
